920: Client Marketing The Client Marketing role is responsible for development and execution of strategic campaigns in partnership with Marketing and Distribution colleagues aimed at acquiring, developing and retaining clients. By utilizing traditional as well as dynamic methods, such as client segmentation, marketing automation, digital and social methods, they aim to execute multi-faceted campaigns that deliver high-quality leads to the sales organization. This job supervises a team of professional level employees and sets goals and objectives for team members to ensure the achievement of department results. Key Responsibilities and Duties Leads strategy development and delivery of Go-To-Market plans for client segments and executes deliverables against plan. Establishes and maintains strong working relationships and collaboration with sales organization and business partners. Owns journey mapping for their respective audience segmentation – including catalogue, prioritization, planning and execution, including the strategic objectives & goals, priorities, stakeholders, target audience (segments), channels, products and processes, and creates the project plan for the journey. Manages campaign planning, development and execution in partnership with Sales and functional marketing team members. Develops appropriate departmental measurements and key performance indicators (KPIs) based on overall business goals. Provides tactical and custom marketing support aligned with Client marketing support model in partnership with functional areas of marketing. Manages team performance through regular, timely feedback as well as the formal performance review process to ensure delivery of exceptional services and engagement, motivation, and team development. Educational Requirements University (Degree) Preferred Work Experience 5+ Years Required; 7+ Years Preferred Physical Requirements Physical Requirements: Sedentary Work Career Level 9PL Work Experience (continued): Experience working in the retirement or defined contribution industry strongly preferred Experience with asset allocation and/or income solution preferred Skills and Capabilities: Strategic thinking to enable impactful delivery and execution of results-driven marketing plans Relationship building to enable strong relationships across the enterprise Digital-first approach to drive deeper engagement with target audiences Analytical skills to help track, measure and interpret success/strategy of marketing programs Detail oriented Strong execution skills Excellent verbal and written skills Proficient in Microsoft applications, including Word, Excel, Powerpoint Base Pay Range: $123,800/yr. - $206,300/yr. Actual base salary may vary based upon, but not limited to, relevant experience, time in role, base salary of internal peers, prior performance, business sector, and geographic location.
